body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

On this particular commit https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/23859/commits/f2271df90c9ad6bb1ef886c396e1373e0ed82ff4 from #23859 clingo likes to arbitrarily toggle `llvm-amdgpu`'s `+/~ rocm-device-libs` variant. With arbitrary I mean it randomly finds a solution that is either + or ~ rocm-device-libs:

```console
$ spack solve spfft +rocm ^llvm-amdgpu@4: | grep rocm-device-libs
            ^llvm-amdgpu@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo+openmp~rocm-device-libs build_type=Release patches=d999f3b235e655ee07f6dd2590302082feaa06d32c5c6b53aae9c5cf1e45b644 arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2
            ^rocm-device-libs@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo build_type=Release arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2

$ spack solve spfft +rocm ^llvm-amdgpu@4: | grep rocm-device-libs
            ^llvm-amdgpu@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo+openmp~rocm-device-libs build_type=Release patches=d999f3b235e655ee07f6dd2590302082feaa06d32c5c6b53aae9c5cf1e45b644 arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2
            ^rocm-device-libs@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo build_type=Release arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2

$ spack solve spfft +rocm ^llvm-amdgpu@4: | grep rocm-device-libs
            ^llvm-amdgpu@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo+openmp+rocm-device-libs build_type=Release patches=d999f3b235e655ee07f6dd2590302082feaa06d32c5c6b53aae9c5cf1e45b644 arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2

$ spack solve spfft +rocm ^llvm-amdgpu@4: | grep rocm-device-libs
            ^llvm-amdgpu@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo+openmp~rocm-device-libs build_type=Release patches=d999f3b235e655ee07f6dd2590302082feaa06d32c5c6b53aae9c5cf1e45b644 arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2
            ^rocm-device-libs@4.2.0%gcc@10.2.0~ipo build_type=Release arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2
```

The default is `llvm-amdgpu +rocm-device-libs`, but IF you'd toggle it to `llvm-amdgpu ~rocm-device-libs`, it introduces a dependency on `rocm-device-libs ^llvm-amdgpu ~rocm-device-libs`, which may explain why it's not reflected in the `solve` score:
